stories.text:
I'm considering finding a new job with a relaxed attitude to hybrid/fully remote working (long term, not just Covid-related), and a focus on delivery rather than physical presence.

My employer (large US financial firm) has taken the view that everyone needs to be present in the office now (hotdesking too), despite record productivity with everyone remote over the last 18 months. Nearly all meetings are still via Zoom with people in other global offices.

Which companies are going to be like this long-term?
stories.title: Ask HN: Which companies are forcing engineers back to the office?
